name: Network Protocols
description: Sector template for network protocol patents including transport protocols, application protocols, and protocol stacks.
contextDescription: Network protocol patents cover communication protocols and standards. Key areas include transport protocols (TCP/UDP variants, QUIC), application protocols (HTTP, DNS), and protocol optimization. High-value targets include Google (QUIC), Cloudflare, Akamai, and all CDN/edge providers. Standards-essential patents have significant licensing potential.
scoringGuidance: QUIC/HTTP3 patents target Google and modern web infrastructure.
TCP optimization patents apply to all networked systems.
DNS/naming patents target Cloudflare, Akamai, cloud providers.
Protocol security patents (TLS improvements) are broadly applicable.
Low-latency protocol patents target gaming, trading, real-time apps.

questions.question: What protocol layer does this patent cover (transport, session, application)?
questions.reasoningPrompt: Identify the protocol layer and its ubiquity.

questions.question: Is this relevant to IETF or other protocol standards? Standards patents have licensing value.
Is this relevant to web infrastructure (CDN, edge, HTTP/QUIC)?
questions.reasoningPrompt: Web infrastructure is deployed at massive scale.
